<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 323, 292]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9231/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 368, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Further Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 340]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 270, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 866, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 213, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 730, 713]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75. The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 79, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 76, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\int_{6}^{7} \frac{1}{\sqrt{(x-5)^2 - 1}} \mathrm{d}x\), giving your answer in the form \(\ln(a + \sqrt{b})\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 112, 920, 131]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 320, 88]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 100, 574, 121]]<|/det|>
\[4y^{2} + 4\ln (xy) = 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 147, 144, 166]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 144, 512, 170]]<|/det|>
Show that, at the point \(\left(2, \frac{1}{2}\right)\) on \(C\), \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = -\frac{1}{6}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 148, 917, 166]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 82, 148, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 76, 460, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^2 y}{\mathrm{dx}^2}\) at the point \(\left(2, \frac{1}{2}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 71, 415, 89]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[237, 97, 761, 123]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{1}{2}\mathrm{e}^{2t} - \frac{1}{3} t^3 - \frac{1}{2}, \qquad y = 2\mathrm{e}^t (t - 1), \qquad \text{for } 0 \leqslant t \leqslant 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 133, 329, 152]]<|/det|>
Find the exact length of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 918, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 69, 94, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 69, 148, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 69, 455, 88]]<|/det|>
Use de Moivre's theorem to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[336, 92, 660, 128]]<|/det|>
\[\cot 6\theta = \frac{\cot^6\theta - 15\cot^4\theta + 15\cot^2\theta - 1}{6\cot^5\theta - 20\cot^3\theta + 6\cot\theta}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 102, 918, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 455, 88]]<|/det|>
Hence obtain the roots of the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 100, 667, 120]]<|/det|>
\[x^{6} - 6x^{5} - 15x^{4} + 20x^{3} + 15x^{2} - 6x - 1 = 0\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 133, 547, 152]]<|/det|>
in the form \(\cot(q\pi)\), where \(q\) is a rational number.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 71, 544, 89]]<|/det|>
Find the particular solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 92, 589, 125]]<|/det|>
\[3\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}} + 2\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} + y = x^{2},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 127, 406, 153]]<|/det|>
given that, when \(x = 0\), \(y = \frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 131, 917, 150]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 92, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[344, 87, 650, 384]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 396, 920, 444]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = \mathrm{e}^{1 - x}\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\), together with a set of \(n\) rectangles of width \(\frac{1}{n}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 448, 144, 469]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 444, 863, 476]]<|/det|>
By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that \(\int_{0}^{1} \mathrm{e}^{1 - x} \mathrm{d}x < U_n\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 476, 920, 512]]<|/det|>
\[U_{n} = \frac{\mathsf{e} - 1}{n(1 - \mathsf{e}^{-\frac{1}{n}})}. \quad [4]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 79, 146, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 757, 102]]<|/det|>
Use a similar method to find, in terms of \(n\), a lower bound \(L_{n}\) for \(\int_{0}^{1} \mathrm{e}^{1 - x} \mathrm{dx}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 78, 920, 98]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 98, 915, 123]]<|/det|>
<form>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 504, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 96, 598, 123]]<|/det|>
\[\sinh 2x\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} +2y = \sinh 2x\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 683, 151]]<|/det|>
for which \(y = 5\) when \(x = \ln 2\). Give your answer in an exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 316, 89]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 98, 566, 153]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} -2 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 7 & 9 \\ 4 & 1 & 7 \end{pmatrix}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 164, 146, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 163, 920, 198]]<|/det|>
Show that the characteristic equation of \(\mathbf{A}\) is \(\lambda^3 - 12\lambda^2 + 12\lambda + 80 = 0\) and find the eigenvalues of \(\mathbf{A}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 180, 920, 198]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 148, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 72, 539, 88]]<|/det|>
Use the characteristic equation of \(\mathbf{A}\) to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[416, 101, 584, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A}^{4} = p\mathbf{A}^{2} + q\mathbf{A} + r\mathbf{I},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 520, 151]]<|/det|>
where \(p\), \(q\) and \(r\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 74, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 710, 92]]<|/det|>
Find a matrix \(\mathbf{P}\) and a diagonal matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that \((\mathbf{A} - 3\mathbf{I})^4 = \mathbf{P}\mathbf{D}\mathbf{P}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 74, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[69, 102, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 72, 562, 87]]<|/det|>
BLANK PAGE
